The traditional creme de menthe formula involves steeping dried peppermint or Corsican mint leaves in grain alcohol for several weeks (creating a naturally green color), followed by filtration and the addition of sugar.

By official government mandate, these rules must be thumb-tacked to the corkboard of every distillery: bourbon must be made from at least 51% corn, aged in new charred oak barrels, begin barrel-aging at no more than 125 proof, and be bottled between 80 and 160 proof.

The Old Forester Mint Julep is the Official Drink of the Kentucky Derby, uniting two great Louisville traditions. 

The most authentic experience of the Kentucky Derby is enjoying a mint julep at the track. For generations, Louisville insiders have enjoyed mint juleps made with Louisvilles Hometown Bourbon  Old Forester  which has been a part of the Louisville scene since 1870 before the first Kentucky Derby in 1875.

The earliest written reference to the Screwdriver is from the October 24, 1949 issue of Time:

"In the dimly lighted bar of the sleek Park Hotel, Turkish intelligence agents mingle with American engineers and Balkan refugees, drinking the latest Yankee concoction of vodka and orange juice, called a 'screwdriver'."
The drink got its name because the American engineers surreptitiously added vodka to small cans of orange juice and stirred the mixture with their screwdrivers.

drinks.name: Whiskey Neat
drinks.description:
Sip to enjoy every bit of spicy notes, vanilla, caramel, and oaky tones without the ice. 

Distilling techniques were brought to Ireland and Scotland sometime between 1100 and 1300 by monks. Since wine was not easily obtained in Ireland and Scotland, barley beer was distilled into liquor which became whisky.

drinks.name: Whiskey Shot
drinks.description: Shot of Whiskey

drinks.name: Whiskey Sour
drinks.description:
A delicious combination of whiskey and sour mix

The oldest historical mention of a whisky sour prepared in the world comes from a newspaper published in Wisconsin in 1870. In 1962, the Universidad del Cuyo published a story which cited a Peruvian newspaper called El Comercio de Iquique as indicating that Elliott Stubb created the "whiskey sour" in 1872.

drinks.name: Whiskey Special
drinks.description: A shot of Whiskey mixed with Ginger Ale and a splash of Root Beer.

drinks.name: Whiskey Special
drinks.description: Whiskey and Ginger Ale with a splash of Root Beer.

drinks.name: Woodford Reserve on the Rocks
drinks.description: The Official Bourbon of Churchill Downs for the past 17 years.
drinks.instructions: Add ice to a rocks glass and place in cup compartment. Press pour and enjoy.

drinks.name: Woodford Reserve Whiskey Sour
drinks.description: Made with Woodford Reserve, the Official Bourbon of Churchill Downs for the past 17 years, the Whiskey Sour is a classic cocktail and a staple for whiskey cocktails.

drinks.name: Woo Woo
drinks.description: This vodka, cranberry juice, and peach schnapps cocktail is as fun as its name.
drinks.history: The cocktail can be transformed into a party punch by combining the ingredients in a quantity to fill a punch bowl and mixing it well before setting out.
drinks.instructions: Fill collins Glass with ice and place in cup compartment. Press pour. Stir and garnish with lime wedge.
